name: CHLORHEXIDINE GLUCONATE
side-effects:
Side-effects mucosal irritation (if desquamation occurs, discontinue
treatment or dilute mouthwash with an equal volume of water); taste
disturbance; reversible brown staining of teeth, and of silicate or
composite restorations; tongue discoloration; parotid gland swelling
reportedNote Chlorhexidine gluconate
may be incompatible with some ingredients in toothpaste; leave an
interval of at least 30 minutes between using mouthwash and toothpaste
doses:
oral hygiene and plaque inhibition and gingivitis, brush
on the teeth once or twice daily

oral hygiene and plaque inhibition, oral candidiasis,
gingivitis, and management of aphthous ulcers, rinse mouth with 10 mL
for about 1 minute twice daily

oral hygiene and plaque inhibition, oral candidiasis,
gingivitis, and management of aphthous ulcers, apply as required to
tooth, gingival, or ulcer surfaces using up to 12 actuations (approx.
0.14 mL/actuation) twice daily
